    • convertZonedDateTime

      public ZonedDateTime convertZonedDateTime(ZonedDateTime sourceDate, String destZone)

      This help you to reduce the boilerplate code when calling each time you want to change the time zone

      This is demonstration code for the api client 

           ZoneDateTime dateAndTimeInSydney = convertZonedDateTime("London/UK","Australia/Sydney");
      Parameters:
      sourceDate -
      destZone -
      Returns:
      ZonedDateTime

    • formatInstant

      public static String formatInstant(Instant instant, String timeZone, String pattern)
      Formats a datetime stamp from an instant using a formatting pattern.

      Note: a formatting pattern containing 'a' (for the period; AM/PM) is treated differently at noon/midday. Using that pattern with a datetime whose time falls on "12:00 PM" will cause it to be formatted as "12:00 NOON".

      Parameters:
      instant - the instant to be formatted
      timeZone - the time zone to compute local datetime
      pattern - formatting pattern, see Oracle docs for DateTimeFormatter for pattern table
      Returns:
      the formatted datetime stamp string
